title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks - BBC News
summary: woman airlifted to hospital following a collision between a car and a van at j13-j14 on the m1 northbound .
marks and spencer has confirmed its stevenage store in hertfordshire is one of nine to close in september .
a homeless disabled couple who ca n't drive are demanding to know why they have been put up in a hotel at toddington services .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: have a good weekend
text: that 's all from the local live team for beds , herts and bucks for this week .
we 'll be back again on monday , 3 august at 08:00 .
a round-up of some of our top stories today :

documents.title: drugs gang jailed
text: members of a drugs gang , including a man from bedfordshire , who conspired to import cannabis and cocaine into the uk have been jailed today .

luton crown court heard that davie leitz , 63 , from slovenia , arranged for the drugs to be imported to region before paul taylor , 64 , from dunstall road in barton-le-clay , arranged for them to be delivered to a network of suppliers and dealers in the uk .
police foiled the plan by using covert recordings of the planning stages before any of the drugs made it from columbia via south africa .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: police dog helps detain three hitchin teens
text: a police dog
author: The Comet

documents.title: residents vote in favour of wolverton agora plans
text: people living in wolverton have voted in favour of the town 's development plan .
it means the agora shopping centre is likely to be demolished , and the old railway works will be re-developed .
it was the first referendum of it 's kind in the country , however less than 17 % of people bothered to vote .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather : sunny spells this weekend
text: a fine and dry evening with some sun at times , followed by a dry and partly cloudy night with light winds and some good clear spells , especially later in the night .
a cool night in rural places , such as the chilterns .
minimum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
tomorrow : fine and dry in the morning with some good sunny spells , becoming rather cloudier in the afternoon and evening , though staying mainly dry .
maximum temperature : 21c ( 70f )
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: standon calling festival , we 've arrived !
text: we 've arrived at standon calling festival in hertfordshire and we 're ready to soak up plenty of sun - look at that blue sky - and music .
introducing will be taking over the last dance saloon stage ( tomorrow and showcasing lots of fantastic local artists .
you can listen to some of the bands on our live broadcast
author: BBC Introducing... Beds, Herts & Bucks

documents.title: if you 're just catching up
text: the top stories this evening :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: woman stopped several times trying to travel to syria
text: a woman from east london who had been stopped by police several times attempting to travel to syria said she wanted to care of children suffering in the country .
jamila henry , 22 , from waltham forest , had been stopped at heathrow in january last year , then at luton airport in may , and finally on her way back from syria , at stanstead .
her home in london was searched by police and a laptop and mobile phone were found to contain is propaganda .
but the old bailey heard henry pleaded guilty on the basis she 'd intended to visit syria , though not for military reasons .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: the road to bletchley park
text: this week we 've been telling you how a new exhibition telling the `` untold but crucial '' story of the world war one codebreakers was opened by the duke of kent at bletchley park .
we 've now received more from
using brand new technology , such as marconi crystal receiver listening sets , their work intercepting and deciphering messages changed the course of the war .
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: woman attempted to travel to turkey with sister 's passport
text: after spending four months in police custody , jamila henry , 22 , who was stopped at luton airport in may last year for attempting to travel to turkey with her two-year-old son , has been handed a suspended sentence .
appearing at the old bailey charged with possessing her sister jalila 's passport `` with improper intent '' , jamila henry was sentence to 12 months suspended for two years .
she was ordered to complete 40 days rehabilitation activity .
the court heard she was `` shy and quiet '' compared with her twin sister jalila who was `` outspoken and confident '' .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: police seize alcohol from underage boy at standon calling
text: east hertfordshire rural police are tweeting their patrols of standon calling festival which began today .
in their latest tweet , they
we 've upset a 16yr old , alcohol seized on his way to @ twitterid you do n't need alcohol , you 've got the music .

documents.title: woman held at luton airport avoids jail
text: a woman who was held by counter-terrorism officers at luton airport in may 2014 for travelling with her twin sister 's passport has avoided jail .
appearing at the old bailey today , jamila henry , 22 , from waltham forest , east london , pleaded guilty to possessing her sister jalila 's passport `` with improper intent '' .
more on this shortly .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: robber escaped prison for 13 years
text: a robber , who has been serving a life sentence since 1989 for the murder of hertfordshire 's pc frank mason , wants to clear his name as he claims new evidence casts doubt on his conviction .
james francis hurley , 53 , was acting as a getaway driver during an armed robbery in hemel hempstead , where pc mason ( was shot .
hurley escaped from police when he was being transferred from one prison to another in 1994 and was n't recaptured until 13 years later .
he was re-arrested in the netherlands in 2007 and extradited back to the uk in 2011 .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: queuing traffic and delayed trains
text: there 's queuing traffic on the m25 anti-clockwise at j25 due to an earlier collision .
all lanes have re-opened on the m40 northbound after j6 following a two-vehicle collision .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: delays possible around hatfield house tomorrow
text: anyone travelling near hatfield house tomorrow is being warned of possible delays due to a techno festival .
thousands of people are expected to attend the eastern electrics festival , with heavier traffic than normal expected between 10:00-12:00 then 21:00-23:00 .
the a1000 will be closed between french horn lane and the b6426 from 09:00 to midnight .
several roads will be closed to residents only between 10:00 and midnight , including the ryde , lodge drive , mount pleasant lane , old hertford road , the broadway and church lane .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: just because it 's friday
text: a lady from stevenage popped in to bbc three counties this morning to speak to the mid-morning programme about how much
well i could n't resist a quick cuddle and and obligatory # dogselfie with ewa kasyan 's daschund mini .
please tell me other people do this too ?
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: milton keynes scientists find the building blocks of life in space ?
text: a gas analysis instrument , made by scientist in milton keynes , has found organic compounds present on the comet it landed on last november as part of rosetta spacecraft 's
ptolemy analysed a dust cloud kicked up by philae when it landed on the comet and detected compounds containing carbon , hydrogen and oxygen .

the compounds found are elements that `` will have gone into the mix that led to the formation of the life on earth '' , said ian wright , ou professor of planetary sciences and principal investigator on ptolemy .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: robber imprisoned for murder launches bid to clear name
text: a robber serving a life sentence for the murder of a hertfordshire police officer in the 1980s has launched a bid to clear his name .
james hurley ( in 1994 ) is claiming at london 's appeal court that new evidence casts doubt on his conviction .
hurley was one of three men jailed for killing off duty pc frank mason during an armed robbery in hemel hempstead in 1988 .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: homeless period campaign 'a matter of dignity '
text: two women from hertfordshire have been collecting hundreds of packs of sanitary products to donate to homeless shelters as part of the
sanya masood and sophie harrold , both 24 , became involved because they `` are feminists '' .
they
`` it 's a hygiene issue and a matter of dignity , '' said sophie .
`` i have read stories of these women keeping their tampons in for too long to save money , and with toxic shock syndrome , that is a concern . ''
author: Anisa Kadri
Newsbeat reporter

documents.title: busy on the roads
text: traffic appears to be back to normal on the m1 after two accidents earlier today .
the a5 northbound between dunstable road and hockcliffe is queuing .
on the m25 there are long delays anti-clockwise between j20 and j11 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: mother and cheetah cubs
text: the photograph of the cheetahs at the top of the page today was taken at whipsnade zoo in bedfordshire .
thank you to john o'reilly for this photograph .
i 'd love to see your images of beds , herts and bucks .
they could be anything from paintings of places , or photographs of architecture , landscapes whatever your heart desires !
get in contact

Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

the 22-year-old midfielder appeared 46 times and scored seven goals for the 'galacticos ' reserve outfit .
he 'd joined madrid at 16 and debuted for the castilla side in september 2013 .
`` i 've seen sergio play a number of times and he 's an exceptionally talented player .
he 's very dynamic in his movements and his ball retention as well , '' said boss karl robinson .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

text: the top stories this lunchtime :
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather : pleasant spells of sunshine
text: it will be a fine and dry day , with pleasant spells of sunshine and mostly light winds , although some cloud will bubble up this afternoon .
in the sunshine it will feel warmer today especially towards watford .
maximum temperature : 22c ( 72f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: m & s to close stevenage store
text: marks & spencer has confirmed that their stevenage store in hertfordshire is one of nine to close in september .
the store is one of just three full line stores being axed .
in a statement , the retailer said it was `` making sure our stores are in the best possible locations to serve our customers '' .
about 430 staff will be affected by these closures , who m & s say will be offered redeployment opportunities at nearby stores .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: life after losing a limb
text: viktorija had an emergency amputation on her right leg after a motorbike accident in 2009 and has since got used to life with a prosthetic leg .
`` i woke up and i could see i did n't have a leg '' ,
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: dogs have bacon for breakfast
text: stevenage 's ewa kasyan has caused a stir in the media because she spends £ 500 a month on her six dogs from clothes , to renting fields for them to run around and swimming sessions .
`` they have bacon for breakfast '' , ewa told

`` i mean back in the day , people had to feed their animals what they were eating , so as long as they 're not eating anything poisonous or anything that 's bad for them i do n't see why they ca n't have it . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: cygnet rescued from fishing wire
text: passengers on the famous john bunyan community boat witnessed some heroic action by the volunteers , as they
author: Beds on Sunday

documents.title: woman airlifted to hospital after m1 crash
text: a woman has been airlifted to hospital this morning following a collision between a car and a van at j13-j14 on the m1 northbound .
emergency services were called just before 08:50 and the southbound carriageway was closed to allow the air ambulance to land .
two lanes remain closed northbound .
the woman sustained a neck injury and suspected broken legs .
she was taken to addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: luton council says 'priority is to prevent crisis '
text: the council said it was continuing to experience a severe housing shortage and staff were `` working hard to address the supply and demand problem '' .
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: m1 southbound re-opened
text: all lanes have now re-opened on the m1 southbound j14-j13 after an earlier closure to allow the air ambulance to land .
traffic is queuing for one mile .
the northbound carriageway remains closed j13-j14 .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: seriously pampered pooches
text: we always hear people saying the uk is a nation of dog lovers , but how much do you really love your pooches ?
enough to spend £ 500 on them every month ?
that 's exactly what ewa kasyan , 36 , from stevenage does !

she has six dogs - daschunds mini , maxi , aida-may , stanley , and jack russells lulu and nino - who sleep in her bed , wear clothes , have their teeth brushed daily , have their own massage therapist and eat at her table .
`` i 've got so much love to give them , i just want to spoil them '' , ewa told
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: m1 closure to continue for a while
text: a woman has sustained leg injuries in a collision on the m1 northbound between j13-j14 , the east of england ambulance service say .
emergency services were called just before 08:50 .
an air ambulance is in attendance .
highways england expect the m1 southbound to be back to normal traffic conditions from 11:15 .
the northbound carriageway is expected to re-open from 13:30 .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: fire at empty house in luton
text: a fire at an empty house in luton has destroyed a quarter of the building , bedfordshire fire and rescue service say .
firefighters were called to lansdowne road just before 23:40 to the two-storey detached house .
the blaze was put out by midnight .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: m1 blocked j13-j14
text: the m1 northbound is now blocked between j13 and j14 as a car has gone into the back of a van .
the northbound entry slip road at j13 has also been closed .
southbound , the m1 is also blocked between j14-j13 to allow an air ambulance to attend the northbound accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: service station mum says accommodation 'not suitable '
text: yesterday we told you how a disabled couple from luton have been moved into a hotel in toddington services because the council could n't find them a suitable house .

janet paddison , 23 , who suffers with fibromyalgia , lived in a rented property with her partner , her daughter and an assistance dog until march last year and has been unable to find private accommodation .
she told us they now had no transport , washing or cooking facilities and there was very limited food available at the services .
she said : `` the council need to be looking at suitability not availability . ''
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: travel : m25 accident at st albans
text: three lanes are closed on the anti-clockwise m25 after j22 for the a1081 at st albans due to an accident involving two cars .
traffic is currently queuing for two miles .
get the latest updates from
author: BBC Travel

text: milton keynes dons
the 36-year-old former england international ( left ) , who started his career at luton before a £ 1m move to arsenal in 1997 , was at leicester last season .
he has signed a one year deal at stadium : mk .

documents.title: travel : one lane opens on m1
text: highways england have said there are currently delays of an hour on the northbound m1 between junctions j13 for the a421 at bedford and j15 for the a45 at northampton .
the motorway had been closed between j14 for milton keynes and j15 for several hours after an accident between a lorry and a car in the early hours .
two lanes are currently closed , but the agency says normal traffic conditions are expected from 10:00 .
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: travel : another m1 accident
text: while the northbound m1 remains closed , two lanes are closed on the southbound carriageway at j13 for the a421 at bedford due to an accident involving two lorries and a car .
congestion is currently back to j14 for milton keynes .
get the latest updates from
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: today 's weather : feeling warmer
text: after a chilly start , today is set to be dry , sunny and feeling warmer with a maximum temperature of 22c ( 71f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : overnight m1 closure
text: we understand the m1 is due to re-open shortly following a `` serious accident '' between a lorry and a van in the early hours .
it has been closed northbound between j14 for milton keynes and j15 for the a45 at northampton for investigation work since about 01:00 , with a diversion in place via the a509 and the a5 .
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to today 's live page for bedfordshire , hertfordshire and buckinghamshire , where we 'll bring you the latest news , sport , leisure , travel and weather across the three counties until 18:00 .
as always , we 'd love you to get involved .
email your comments and stories to
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live
